titleproper.value:
Guide to the Robert Colodny Papers
                    <num>ALBA.211</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Jessika Drmacich and Wendy Scheir, 2004

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2012-03-28T16:53-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Robert Colodny (1915-1997) fought with the Abraham Lincoln Brigade in the Spanish Civil War. He returned to the U.S. in 1938 with a severe head injury. He recovered and served in with the U.S. Army in Alaska during World War II. Colodny received his Ph.D. in history and philosophy in 1950 and joined the faculty of the University of Pittsburgh in 1959. In 1961, a Pennsylvania State representative accused Colodny of being a Communist sympathizer, jeopardizing his faculty position at the University of Pittsburgh. After a HUAC hearing and a University inquiry, Colodny was cleared and his position secured. This collection documents Colodnyâ€™s writings from World War II; his work as a writer and editor of academic, political and historical material; his correspondence and activities with the Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigades (VALB); and his lifelong involvement in a range of progressive causes.

p.value:
Published citations should take the following form: 
                <lb/>
                <lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; 
                <lb/>Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives 
                <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library 
                <lb/>70 Washington Square South 
                <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.

<list>
                    <item>
                        <title render="italic">The Struggle for Madrid: The Central Epic of the Spanish Conflict, 1936-37</title>(New York: Paine-Whitman, 1958)</item>
                    <item>
                        <title render="italic">Spain: The Glory and the Tragedy</title>(New York: Humanities Press, 1970)</item>
                    <item>
                        <title render="italic">Spain and Vietnam: The Fight for Freedom</title>(New York : Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade, 1967)</item>
                </list>

This series is comprised of original issues of 
                <title render="italic">The Adakian</title>, the newsletter produced and written by Colodny and Dashiell Hammett in Alaska during World War II, as well as typescripts for radio shows broadcast on July 4th and V-J Day, 1945. Also in this series is a scrapbook of news clippings dating principally from 1961, when Colodny was under investigation by HUAC; two videotaped talks by Colodny; and an undated audio-tape of a Teach-In.
